meanings.definition: To bake (something) for less time than is necessary for it to be fully cooked.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally underbaked the cookies, so they were still doughy in the middle.
meanings.sent2: If you underbake the cake, it will be too moist and dense.
meanings.sent3: The underbaking of the bread made it look like a giant crouton!
meanings.sent4: Underbaking the pie crust is like leaving a story unfinished - it just doesn't feel right.
meanings.sent5: Remember, underbaking the chicken will leave it unsafe to eat.

meanings.definition: The act of not baking something for long enough.
meanings.sent1: Her specialty was the underbaking of pastries, giving them a unique texture.
meanings.sent2: The underbaking of the bread resulted in a pale and soft loaf.
meanings.sent3: The underbaking of the cookies led to a comical scene of guests trying to eat them.
meanings.sent4: His underbaking of the muffins was a metaphor for his tendency to rush through tasks.
meanings.sent5: The underbaking of the pizza left it with a chewy crust and undercooked toppings.
